segments.text: I see the woman standing at the sink, her focus solely on the plate she’s polishing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, creating a small puddle at her feet, yet she remains oblivious to it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel surprised that she hasn’t noticed the mess around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming through the window makes everything look so serene outside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But inside, there’s this quiet chaos brewing, and it’s almost startling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children seem unaware of the risks they’re taking, which adds to my feelings of concern.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is teetering on that stool, reaching for cookies like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if he understands how easily he could fall if that stool tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the girl, standing there with her arm raised, is completely caught up in this little scheme.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels like a recipe for disaster that no one sees coming, not even the woman.
segments.speaker: PAR
